issue.title: Provide an option to see the how the calculator works
issue.body: We've received feedback that it's not clear how the calculator arrives at the various impact levels. We could add a way to peek under the hood and see how each option contributes to the score. This will help users to provide more specific feedback when they see something unexpected.

issue.title: Provide an option to see the how the calculator works
issue.body: We've received feedback that it's not clear how the calculator arrives at the various impact levels. We could add a way to peek under the hood and see how each option contributes to the score. This will help users to provide more specific feedback when they see something unexpected.

comment.body: I've added a debug toggle to show how each option impacts the score.

commits.message:
Update rotation.py

Removed Gerald from triage rotation.

For #7: catch all exceptions from send_triage_reminder.

The root cause of the failure was that our credentials were expired and
unable to be refreshed automatically: I updated the credentials in the
Secrets to address that.

I also now catch all exceptions when sending the reminder to prevent the task
from failing to generate a rotation even if there is an error when
sending the reminder. It would be safer to separate the build tasks but
I didn't want to commit the time.

This push should also generate the rotation that failed and send the
appropriate calendar update.

Merge pull request #21 from mcomella/7-refresh

For #7: catch all exceptions from send_triage_reminder.

pull_request.title: For #7: catch all exceptions from send_triage_reminder.
pull_request.body:
The root cause of the failure was that our credentials were expired and
unable to be refreshed automatically: I updated the credentials in the
Secrets to address that.

I also now catch all exceptions when sending the reminder to prevent the task
from failing to generate a rotation even if there is an error when
sending the reminder. It would be safer to separate the build tasks but
I didn't want to commit the time.

This push should also generate the rotation that failed and send the
appropriate calendar update.

repo.name: perf-triage
repo.description: Tools used for triaging performance bugs.

repo.name: perf-triage
repo.description: Tools used for triaging performance bugs.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -167,14 +166,32 @@ def get_addresses_from_rotation(rotation):
     return [a.get_cal_nick() + "@mozilla.com" for a in attendees]
 
 
-def add_gcal_reminder(is_production, rotation):
+def add_gcal_reminder(is_production, rotation, generated_next_week):
     """Adds a triage reminder event to the Performance Team Google Calendar based on the rotation.
     See the top-of-file comment in gcal.py for requirements to run this function.
 
     This function may raise HttpError for google API or network failures and
     FileNotFoundError if the GCloud Project secrets are missing.
     """
-    if is_production:
+    # TODO: the states (is_production, generated_next_week, & CI envvar) seem confusing - is there a cleaner solution?
comment.body: Perhaps we could add a `send_reminder` argument to `generate_rotation` and call `add_gcal_reminder` from within that method?

pull_request.title: Closes #7: correct GitHub Actions when adding calendar reminders
pull_request.body: I tested the correctness of these changes on my fork.

Update rotation.py

Removed Gerald from triage rotation.

For #7: catch all exceptions from send_triage_reminder.

The root cause of the failure was that our credentials were expired and
unable to be refreshed automatically: I updated the credentials in the
Secrets to address that.

I also now catch all exceptions when sending the reminder to prevent the task
from failing to generate a rotation even if there is an error when
sending the reminder. It would be safer to separate the build tasks but
I didn't want to commit the time.

This push should also generate the rotation that failed and send the
appropriate calendar update.

Merge pull request #21 from mcomella/7-refresh

For #7: catch all exceptions from send_triage_reminder.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -167,14 +166,32 @@ def get_addresses_from_rotation(rotation):
     return [a.get_cal_nick() + "@mozilla.com" for a in attendees]
 
 
-def add_gcal_reminder(is_production, rotation):
+def add_gcal_reminder(is_production, rotation, generated_next_week):
     """Adds a triage reminder event to the Performance Team Google Calendar based on the rotation.
     See the top-of-file comment in gcal.py for requirements to run this function.
 
     This function may raise HttpError for google API or network failures and
     FileNotFoundError if the GCloud Project secrets are missing.
     """
-    if is_production:
+    # TODO: the states (is_production, generated_next_week, & CI envvar) seem confusing - is there a cleaner solution?
comment.body: Perhaps we could add a `send_reminder` argument to `generate_rotation` and call `add_gcal_reminder` from within that method?
